member.name: T:OscLib.OscAddressPart
member.summary: Represents a part of an OSC Address Space.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscAddressPart._name
member.summary: Name of this address part.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscAddressPart.Name
member.summary: Name of this address part.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscAddressPart.#ctor(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Creates a new address part.
member.param: Name of this address part. Can't contain reserved symbols.
member.exception: Thrown when name does contain reserved symbols. Pls no, thx.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscAddressPart.ToString
member.summary: Returns the name of this address part as a standard string.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscContainer
member.summary: Represents an OSC method container, to be used within the OSC Address Space - basically a folder for methods and containers.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscContainer.Length
member.summary: The number of elements within this container.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscContainer.Item(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Indexer access to the elements of this container, using their names.
member.param: Name of the element.
member.returns: The element with the provided name, or null if it's not in this container.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscContainer.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Indexer access to the elements of this container, using their indices.
member.param: Index of the element.
member.returns: The element under the provided index.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscContainer.#ctor(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Creates a new OSC Container.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscContainer.AddPart(OscLib.OscAddressPart)
member.summary: Adds an OSC container or a method to this container.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscContainer.RemovePart(OscLib.OscAddressPart)
member.summary: Removes an OSC container or a method from this container, if it's inside this container.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscContainer.RemovePart(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Removes an OSC container or a method with a specified name from this container, if it's inside this container.
member.exception: Thrown when an element with the provided name is not present inside this container.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscContainer.ContainsPart(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Checks if container contains an address part with a provided name (or adhering to a provided pattern).

member.name: T:OscLib.OscMethod
member.summary: Represents an OSC Method, to be used with the OSC Address Space - that is called when an appropriate OSC message is received.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscMethod.DelegateName
member.summary: The name of the attached method delegate.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscMethod.#ctor(OscLib.OscString,OscLib.OscMethodDelegate)
member.summary: Creates a new OSC Method and links it with the provided delegate.
member.param: The name of the OSC Method. This will be used to invoke it when receiving messages.
The delegate pointing to a method that should be invoked with this OSC Method.
member.exception: Thrown when the provided delegate method is null.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscMethod.Invoke(System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes the attached method delegate.
member.param: An array of arguments to pass to the delegate.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscMidi
member.summary: Implements a MIDI message sent over the OSC Protocol.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscString
member.summary: Implements an OSC Protocol-compliant string - ASCII-based, null-terminated, length a multiple of 4 - that can be used with and easily converted to and from standard .NET strings.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscString.NullString
member.summary: Returns a null OscString - that is, an OSC string containing a single null symbol.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscString.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Indexer access to the characters of this string, as ASCII codes.
member.param: Index of the char.
member.returns: A char as an ASCII code. Will return "0" (ASCII null) when out of range.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates an OSC String out of a byte array.
member.param: The source byte array.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an OSC String out of a part of a byte array.
member.param: The source byte array.
The start index.
The length of the string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an OSC String out of a plain old string.
member.param: The source plain old string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.#ctor(System.Byte[],OscLib.Trit,OscLib.Trit)
member.summary: Internal constructor for copying strings while preserving the information about them containing special symbols.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.CopyTo(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the elements of this string's byte array into the specified one-dimentional byte array, starting from the index provided.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this OSC string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.Split(System.Byte)
member.summary: Splits the OSC String into an array of new OSC Strings, using the provided symbol.
member.param: The ASCII encoding of a symbol by which to split the string.
member.returns: An array of resulting OSC Strings.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.GetChars
member.summary: Returns a copy of an array containing all characters (their ASCII codes as bytes, that is) in this string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.GetOscBytes
member.summary: Returns a copy of an array containing all chars (their ASCII codes as bytes, that is).

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.GetSubstring(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a substring from this string.
member.param: The index at which the substring starts.
The length of the substring.
member.exception: Thrown when "start" is beyond the string's length, or when "length" is too large.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.PatternMatch(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Compares this string to a pattern, returns whether they match or not.
member.param: The pattern to which the string is compared.
member.returns: True if string matches the pattern, false if not (duh).
member.exception: Thrown when either the curly brackets or the square brackets aren't closed in the pattern.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.ContainsSpecialSymbols
member.summary: Whether this string contains special symbols reserved by OSC protocol. Checks when first called (can get quite expensive, depending on the length of the string), then caches the result.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.ContainsPatternMatching
member.summary: Whether this string contains any pattern-matching symbols reserved by OSC protocol. Checks when first called (can get quite expensive, depending on the length of the string), then caches the result.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.ToString
member.summary: Returns the OSC string as an actual string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the OSC string to an object.
member.param: Object to compare to.
member.returns: Whether the OSC string is equal to object.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code of the OSC string, so it can be used as a key in dictionaries, for example.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.op_Equality(OscLib.OscString,OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Allows to compare OSC strings to each other.
member.param: First string.
Second string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.op_Inequality(OscLib.OscString,OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Allows to compare OSC strings to each other.
member.param: First string.
Second string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.op_Implicit(System.String)~OscLib.OscString
member.summary: Allows to implicitly convert strings to OscStrings.
member.param: String to be converted.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.op_Explicit(OscLib.OscString)~System.String
member.summary: Allows to explicitly convert OscStrings to strings.
member.param: OscString to be converted.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.IsNullOrEmpty(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Returns true if the provided OscString is null (only contains null symbols) or empty (doesn't contain any symbols).
member.param: The OscString to be checked.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscTimetag
member.summary: Describes an OSC Timetag both as a 64 bit fixed-point NTP timestamp and a tick value useable by DateTime and TimeSpan.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimetag.#ctor(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates an OSC Timetag out of the provided DateTime object.
member.param: The source DateTime object.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimetag.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates an OSC Timetag using DateTime or TimeSpan ticks. Ticks need to adhere to UTC time in order to produce correct results.
member.param: UTC-based tick value.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimetag.#ctor(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Creates an OSC Timetag out of an NTP-format timestamp.
member.param: An ulong containing a 64-bit fixed-point NTP-format timestamp.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimetag.GetDateTime
member.summary: Returns this timetag represented as a DateTime object, corresponding to the time zone of the system.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimetag.GetDateTimeUtc
member.summary: Returns this timetag represented as a DateTime object, corresponding to UTC time.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimetag.ToString
member.summary: Returns this timetag as a string, formatted as "day / month / year hours : minutes : seconds : milliseconds".

member.name: T:OscLib.IOscPacket
member.summary: Describes a structure that contains an OSC packet in binary form.

member.name: P:OscLib.IOscPacket.BinaryData
member.summary: OSC-compliant binary data contained within the packet.

member.name: P:OscLib.IOscPacket.OscLength
member.summary: Packet length in bytes.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscBundle
member.summary: Represents a deserialized OSC packet bundle. May contain both messages and bundles. Bundles inside a bundle should be time-tagged

member.name: F:OscLib.OscBundle.BundleHeaderLength
member.summary: The length of the bundle header in bytes. That is, the "#bundle " + [timestamp] bit.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscBundle.MarkerStringLength
member.summary: The Length of the "#bundle " string in bytes that should be present in the beginning of a bundle.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscBundle.Timetag
member.summary: Timestamp attached to this bundle.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscBundle.Messages
member.summary: Messages inside this bundle.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscBundle.Bundles
member.summary: Bundles inside this bundle.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscBundle.#ctor(OscLib.OscTimetag,OscLib.OscBundle[],OscLib.OscMessage[])
member.summary: Creates an OSC Bundle out of an array of messages and an array of bundles.
member.param: An OSC Timetag of this bundle.
An array of OSC Bundles to be packed into this bundle.
An array of OSC Messages to be packed into this bundle.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscBundle.#ctor(OscLib.OscTimetag,OscLib.OscBundle[])
member.summary: Creates an OSC bundle out of an array of OSC messages.
member.param: An OSC Timetag of this bundle.
An array of OSC messages to be packed into this bundle.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscBundle.#ctor(OscLib.OscTimetag,OscLib.OscMessage[])
member.summary: Creates an OSC bundle out of an array of OSC messages.
member.param: An OSC Timetag of this bundle.
An array of OSC messages to be packed into this bundle.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscBundle.#ctor(OscLib.OscTimetag)
member.summary: Creates an empty OSC Bundle. Now why would you do that.
member.param: A OSC Timetag of this sad empty bundle.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscBundle.CopyMarkerStringTo(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the bundle marker string ("#bundle ") to array, starting at the specified index.
member.param: Target array.
Target index.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscBundle.ToString
member.summary: Returns this bundle as a neatly formatted string, for debug purposes mostly.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscBundle.ToShiftedString(System.Int32)
member.summary: A debug method to print bundles inside of bundles easier. Does the same thing as the standard ToSpring() but adds some spaces after every new line.
member.param: How many spaces to add aftear each new line

member.name: T:OscLib.OscMessage
member.summary: Represents a single OSC message.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscMessage.AddressPattern
member.summary: OSC address pattern of this message.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscMessage.Arguments
member.summary: Arguments of this message.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscMessage.#ctor(OscLib.OscString,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a new OSC message out of an address pattern and an array of arguments.
member.param: Address pattern attached to this message.
An array of arguments attached to this message. Can be null if no arguments are needed.
member.exception: Thrown when the address pattern is empty or invalid.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscMessage.ToString
member.summary: Returns this message as a neatly formatted string, for debug purposes mostly.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscPacket
member.summary: Represents an OSC packet serialized into binary.
member.remarks: The purpose of this struct is to basically clearly designate a byte array as containing OSC binary data. Nothing more, nothing less - if a byte array is wrapped inside this struct, it should be safe to use with anything OSC-related.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscPacket.BinaryData
member.summary: Binary data contained inside this packet.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscPacket.OscLength
member.summary: Length of the data.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscPacket.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new OSC Packet out of the provided byte array containing OSC data (hopefully).
member.param: Should contain valid OSC binary data. This constructor does VERY minimal validation, so use at your own risk.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscPacket.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new OSC Packet out of a part of the provided byte array containing OSC data (hopefully).
member.param: Should contain valid OSC binary data for the relevant length. This constructor does VERY minimal validation, so use at your own risk.
The index from which to relevant part of the byte array begins.
The length of the relevant part of the byte array.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscPacket.ToString
member.summary: Returns the binary contents of the packet, formatted to display 16 bytes per line.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscDeserializer
member.summary: Deserializes OSC binary data, translating it into readable messages and bundles.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscDeserializer.GetInt32(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an int out of the byte array.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscDeserializer.GetInt64(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a long out of the byte array.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscDeserializer.GetTimetag(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a timestamp out of the byte array.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscDeserializer.GetFloat32(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a float out of the byte array.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscDeserializer.GetFloat64(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a double out of the byte array.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscDeserializer.GetBlob(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a binary blob out of the byte array.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscDeserializer.GetString(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a string out of the byte array, using a pointer.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscDeserializer.GetInt32(System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets an int out of the byte array, using an external pointer.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscDeserializer.GetInt64(System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets a longint out of the byte array, using an external pointer.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscDeserializer.GetTimetag(System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets a timestamp out of the byte array, using an external pointer.
member.param: Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.
Byte array containing the data.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscDeserializer.GetFloat32(System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets a float out of the byte array, using an external pointer.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.summary: Gets a double out of the byte array, using an external pointer.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.summary: Gets a binary blob out of the byte array, using an external pointer.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.summary: Gets a string out of the byte array, using an external pointer.
member.param: Byte array containing the data.
Pointing at the index from which the relevant bytes begin.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.Chunk32
member.summary: Length in bytes of a single (32 bits/4 bytes long) OSC data chunk.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.Chunk64
member.summary: Length in bytes of a double-sized (64 bits/8 bytes long) OSC data chunk.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchAnySequence
member.summary: Stands for any sequence of zero or more characters in pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchAnyChar
member.summary: Stands for any single character in pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchCharArrayOpen
member.summary: Opens an array of characters in pattern matching. A match will occur if any of the characters within the array corresponds to a single character.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchCharArrayClose
member.summary: Closes an array of characters in pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchNot
member.summary: "Reverses" the character array, matching it with any symbol *not* present in it.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchRange
member.summary: A range symbol used inside character arrays. Stands for the entire range of ASCII symbols between the two around it.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchStringArrayOpen
member.summary: Opens an array of strings in pattern matching. A match will occur if any of the strings within the array matches to a sequence of characters.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchStringArrayClose
member.summary: Closes an array of strings in pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.BundleMarker
member.summary: Designates the start of an OSC Bundle.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.Separator
member.summary: Separates parts of an address string inside OSC Messages. Always should be present at the start of an address string.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.Comma
member.summary: Designates the beginning of an OSC type tag string inside messages. Separates strings in string arrays when pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.Space
member.summary: Personal space. Not allowed in OSC Method or Container names, otherwise insignificant.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscProtocol.IsSpecialSymbol(System.Byte)
member.summary: Checks whether the provided byte represents an ASCII symbol reserved by the OSC Protocol.
member.param: ASCII symbol as a byte.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscSerializer
member.summary: Serializes data into bytes. Makes sure it is big-endian where appropriate.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.GetBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts an integer into a byte array, swapping its endianness if needed.
member.param: An integer to be converted.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.AddBytes(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Converts an integer into bytes and adds them to an existing array, swapping their endianness if needed and shifting the pointer accordingly.
member.param: An integer to be converted.
The target byte array.
The index from which to add data. Will be shifted forwards by the length of added data.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.AddBytes(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts an integer into bytes and adds them to an existing array, swapping their endianness if needed.

The target byte array.
The index from which to add data.

member.param: A longint to be converted.
The target byte array.
The index from which to add data. Will be shifted forwards by the length of added data.

member.summary: A basic implementation of a yes-no-maybe boolean-like thing.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscConvert
member.summary: Implements a set methods allowing for converting messages and bundles into OSC byte data and back.
member.remarks: This base class implements methods for converting OSC Messages and Bundles to OSC Packets and vice versa, but implementing the exact methods for serializing and deserializing arguments is left to derived classes. Different applications utilising OSC might have slightly different implementations of the OSC protocol -- some don't use double-length floats, some use an integer equal to 1 or 0 instead of T and F typetags for sending booleans, some use custom typetags, and so on. Some applications don't even allow any arguments apart from the bare standard int32, float32, OSC-string and OSC-blob. All this can be accounted for in method overloads in the derived classes.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscConvert._settingEmptyTypeTagStrings
member.summary: Controls whether this version of OSC Protocol demands adding an empty type tag string (that is, a comma followed by three null bytes) when there aren't any arguments.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscConvert.SettingEmptyTypeTagStrings
member.summary: Controls whether this version of OSC Protocol demands adding an empty type tag string (that is, a comma followed by three null bytes) when there aren't any arguments.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscConvert.AddMessageAsBytes(OscLib.OscMessage,System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Serializes the provided OSC Message into byte data, adds it to the provided byte array.
member.param: The message to convert to bytes.
The byte array to add the message data to.
The external pointer designating the index from which to add data to array. Will be shifted forwards by the length of added data.
member.exception: Thrown if the provided data array is too small to fit the message into.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscConvert.AddBundleAsBytes(OscLib.OscBundle,System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Serializes the provided OSC Bundle into byte data, adds it to the provided byte array.
member.param: The bundle to convert to bytes.
The byte array to add bundle data to.
The external pointer designating the index from which to add data to array. Will be shifted forwards by the length of added data.

member.summary: Orders the provided OSC Messages into a byte array of OSC Bundle "contents", adds it to the provided byte array starting from the provided pointer.
member.param: An array of OSC Messages to order.
The target byte array.
The data will be added to target array from this index onwards. This pointer will be shifted forwards by the length of added data.

member.summary: Orders the provided OSC Bundles into a byte array of OSC Bundle "contents", adds it to the provided byte array starting from the provided pointer.
member.param: An array of OSC Bundles to order.
The target byte array.
The data will be added to target array from this index onwards. This pointer will be shifted forwards by the length of added data.

member.summary: Orders the provided OSC Packets into a byte array of OSC Bundle "contents", adds it to the provided byte array starting from the provided pointer.
member.param: An array of OSC Packets to order.
The target byte array.
The data will be added to target array from this index onwards. This pointer will be shifted forwards by the length of added data.

member.summary: Creates an OSC Message out of the provided address pattern and argument array, converts it into an OSC Packet.

The arguments

Points at the start of the message. Will be shifted forwards to the end of the message.
The length of this message in bytes.
member.exception: Thrown when no message is found at pointer position.
Thrown when the message can't be parsed or has errors.

member.summary: Creates an OSC Message out of the provided OSC binary packet.
member.typeparam: The packet struct fed into this method should implement the IOscPacket interface. Obviously, it should contain readable OSC data as well.
member.param: The packet to be deserialized.
member.remarks: The method is generic to avoid the struct-as-interface boxing/unboxing shenanigans.

member.summary: Deserializes an OSC Bundle from the byte array.

member.summary: Creats an OSC Bundle out of the provided OSC binary packet.

member.summary: Calculates the byte length of the provided OSC Bundle according to this OSC Protocol implementation's specifics.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscConvert.GetArgAsBytes``1(``0,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Serializes the provided argument into its OSC byte data form and returns it as an array of bytes, provides the corresponding type tag.
member.remarks: Implemented the way it is to minimize boxing.
member.param: Argument to be serialized.
Will return the OSC type tag for the provided argument.
member.returns: The byte array containing the argument converted to OSC Protocol-compliant binary.
member.exception: Thrown when the argument is of an unsupported type.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscConvert.AddArgAsBytes``1(``0,System.Byte[],System.Int32@,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Serializes the provided argument into its OSC byte data form and adds it into an existing byte array, provides the corresponding type tag.
member.remarks: Implemented the way it is to minimize boxing.
member.param: The argument to be serialized.
The target byte array.
The index from which to add data. Will be shifted forwards by the length of added data.
Corresponding OSC type tag.
member.exception: Thrown when the argument is of an unsupported type.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscConvert.GetArgLength``1(``0)
member.summary: Returns the provided argument's OSC byte length.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscConvert.BytesToArg(System.Byte[],System.Int32@,System.Byte)
member.summary: Deserializes the part of provided byte array into an object representing the OSC Message argument, starting from the pointer position and according to the provided type tag. Shifts the pointer forward accordingly.
member.remarks: Words cannot describe how much I HATE the fact that this returns arguments as object, requiring boxing and thus causing the dreaded GC pressure. But, alas, I'm currently too stupid to figure out some clever way to avoid this. There is probably a way to deal with this, but it'll have to wait.
member.param: The byte array containing OSC byte data.
The external pointer designating the position from which the relevant data starts.
The type tag of the argument contained in the data.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscConvert.AddBundleHeader(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a bundle header to the target byte array, starting from the specified index. Tags it with the "execute immediately" timetag.
member.remarks: "Adds" means "overwrites the next 16 bytes with the bundle header", by the way, so it's probably best to make sure there's nothing important there first.
member.param: Target byte array to modify.
Target index.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscConvert.AddBundleHeader(System.Byte[],System.Int32,OscLib.OscTimetag)
member.summary: Adds a bundle header to the target byte array, starting from the specified index and using the provided timetag.
member.remarks: "Adds" means "overwrites the next 16 bytes with the bundle header", by the way, so it's probably best to make sure there's nothing important there first.
member.param: Target byte array to modify.
Target index.
To be included in the header.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscConvertFull
member.summary: An implementation of a "full" version of OSC Protocol - supporting all additional data types designated in the spec.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscConvertMini
member.summary: An implementation of a basic, bare-bones version of OSC Protocol - only supporting Int32, Float32, Osc-String and Osc-Blob as arguments. Everything else will be converted into one of these if possible, or discarded outright.

member.name: T:OscLib.LinkMode
member.summary: Describes the current mode of operation of an OSC Link.

member.name: F:OscLib.LinkMode.Closed
member.summary: OSC Link is closed.

member.name: F:OscLib.LinkMode.Targeted
member.summary: OSC Link is open and connected to a specific end point. It will only receive and send packets from and to that end point.

member.name: F:OscLib.LinkMode.Wide
member.summary: OSC Link is open to communicate with any end point.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscLink
member.summary:
Used to send and receive OSC messages over UDP. Can operate in two modes: targeted to one specific endpoint, or wide-open free-for-all.
To Do: Add TCP support.

member.summary: Shows the status of the receive task. Defaults to "WaitingToRun" when the task is not present.

member.name: E:OscLib.OscLink.MessageReceived
member.summary: Invoked when this OSC Link receives a message. The message is deserialized.

member.name: E:OscLib.OscLink.BundleReceived
member.summary: Invoked when this OSC Link receives a bundle or a batch of bundles. Received data is deserialized into a "flat" array containing all valid bundles.

member.name: E:OscLib.OscLink.PacketReceived
member.summary: Invoked when this OSC Link receives any packet of binary OSC data. The packet is passed as is.

member.name: E:OscLib.OscLink.MessageSent
member.summary: Invoked when this OSC Link sends out an OSC packet containing a message. On invocation, the message is deserialized into readible form.

member.name: E:OscLib.OscLink.BundleSent
member.summary: Invoked when this OSC Link sends out an OSC packet containing a bundle or a batch of bundles. On invocation, the bundles are deserialized back into readible form.

member.name: E:OscLib.OscLink.ReceiveTaskExceptionRaised
member.summary: Invoked when there is an exception inside the receive task. Allows to catch exceptions without crashing the task, if desired.

member.exception: Thrown if the provided EndPoint is null.
Thrown if the OSC Link is already open.
The port number is out of range.
Couldn't open a socket.

member.exception: Thrown if the provided IP end point is null.
Thrown if the OSC Link is already open.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.SendToTarget``1(``0)
member.summary: Sends an OSC packet to the target end point of this OSC Link.
member.typeparam: The packet should implement the IOscPacket interface.
member.param: OSC Packet to be sent.
member.exception: Thrown if OSC link is not in target mode.
Thrown if trying to send null instead of binary data.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.SendToTarget``1(``0,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends a *part* of the provided OSC Packet to the target end point of this OSC Link.
member.remarks: This method is useful when the packet contains rubbish/nulls at the end of it - for example, this can happen when using cache arrays to concatinate multiple packets into one bundle. This helps to avoid copying data to a new array in order to truncate it, which in turn avoids creating unnecessary GC pressure. Obviously, this method is *to be used with caution* - there are all sorts of bugs and weird edge cases that might crop up, and it's much safer to use isolated, non-cache arrays in general.
member.typeparam: The packet should implement the IOscPacket interface.
member.param: OSC Packet to be sent.
The length of useful data within the packet (in bytes) starting from the beginning of the packet. Everything outside this length will be discarded.
member.exception: Thrown if OSC link is not in target mode.
Thrown if trying to send null instead of binary data.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.SendToEndPoint``1(``0,System.Net.IPEndPoint)
member.summary: Sends an OSC packet to the specified end point.
member.typeparam: The packet should implement the IOscPacket interface.
member.param: OSC binary data packet to be sent.
The end point to which the packet will be sent.
member.exception: Thrown if OSC Link is not in wide mode.
Thrown if trying to send null instead of binary data.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.SendToEndPoint``1(``0,System.Int32,System.Net.IPEndPoint)
member.summary: Sends a *part* of the provided OSC Packet to the specified end point.
member.remarks: This method is useful when the packet contains rubbish/nulls at the end of it - for example, this can happen when using cache arrays to concatinate multiple packets into one bundle. This helps to avoid copying data to a new array in order to truncate it, which in turn avoids creating unnecessary GC pressure. Obviously, this method is *to be used with caution* - there are all sorts of bugs and weird edge cases that might crop up, and it's much safer to use isolated, non-cache arrays in general.
member.typeparam: The packet should implement the IOscPacket interface.
member.param: OSC Packet to be sent.
The length of useful data within the packet (in bytes) starting from the beginning of the packet. Everything outside this length will be discarded.
The end point to which the packet will be sent.
member.exception: Thrown if OSC link is not in target mode.
Thrown if trying to send null instead of binary data.

member.param: Byte array containing the OSC data being sent out.
The end point to which the data is being sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.GetLocalEndPoint
member.summary: Returns an end point at a local address on a random open port.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.GetLocalEndPointWithPort(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an end point at a local address with the requested port number (subject to availability).

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.ToString
member.summary: Prints out the status of this OSC Link as a nicely formatted string.
member.returns: A formatted string containing status information.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscReceiver
member.summary:
Implements an OSC Address Space, associating C# method delegates with OSC Methods. Processes messages and bundles coming from the attached OSC Link, pattern matching if needed.
To Do: implement a buffer and delay system to properly adhere OSC Protocol's rules on timestamps, etc. Currently all bundles will be processed as they come, unless their timestamp is in the past.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscReceiver.RootContainerName
member.summary: The default name of the root container.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscReceiver._root
member.summary: The root container, from which the rest of the OSC Address Space stems.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscReceiver._addressSpaceAccess
member.summary: Controls access to the OSC Address Space when trying to add/remove addresses.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscReceiver._connectedLinksAccess
member.summary: Controls access to the list of connected links.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscReceiver._connectedLinks
member.summary: Contains all links this receiver is connected to.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscReceiver.Root
member.summary: The root container, from which the rest of the OSC Address Space stems.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscReceiver.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new OSC Receiver.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscReceiver.Connect(OscLib.OscLink)
member.summary: Connects this Receiver to an OSC Link.
member.param: An OSC Link to receive messages from. Make sure its "message/bundle received" events are on, otherwise nothing will happen.
member.exception: Thrown if the provided OSC Link is null.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscReceiver.Disconnect(OscLib.OscLink)
member.summary: Disconnects this Receiver from an OSC Link.
member.param: The OSC Link to be disconnected.
member.exception: Thrown if the provided OSC Link is null.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscReceiver.Process(OscLib.OscMessage[])
member.summary: Processes incoming message batches, invoking the appropriate OSC Methods.
member.param: A batch of OSC messages to process.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscReceiver.Process(OscLib.OscMessage)
member.summary: Processes a single incoming message, invoking the appropriate OSC Methods.
member.param: An OSC message to process.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscReceiver.ReceiveBundle(OscLib.OscBundle,System.Net.IPEndPoint)
member.summary: Processes an incoming bundle. Invoked when the connected OSC Link receives bundles.
member.param: OSC Bundle to process.
The IP end point from which the bundle was received.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscReceiver.ReceiveMessage(OscLib.OscMessage,System.Net.IPEndPoint)
member.summary: Processes an incoming message. Invoked when the connected OSC Link receives a message.
member.param: An OSC message to process.
The IP end point from which the message was received.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscReceiver.AddMethod(OscLib.OscString,OscLib.OscMethodDelegate)
member.summary: Adds an OSC Method to the specified address in the OSC Address Space.
member.param: The address of this OSC Method. Shouldn't contain any reserved symbols except for separators. The last part of the pattern is used as the method's name.
The method delegate that will be attached to the OSC Method, to be invoked when the method is triggered by an OSC message.
member.exception: Thrown when the address pattern is invalid.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscReceiver.AddContainer(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Adds an OSC Container to the specified address in the OSC Address Space.
member.param: The address of this OSC Container. Shouldn't contain any reserved symbols except for separators. The last part of the pattern is used as the container's name.
member.exception: Thrown when the address pattern is invalid.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscReceiver.RemoveAddress(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary:
Removes the specified address (be it a container or a method) from the address space.
Warning: pattern matching not yet implemented, attempts will cause an exception.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscReceiver.ToString
member.summary: Prints the entire OSC Address Space as a tree.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscSender`1
member.summary: Implements a multi-priority sender queue to work with an OSC Link, for message bundling and orderly sending. OSC Link needs to be in targeted mode when operating.
member.typeparam: The particular type of the OSC Packet used with this Sender. Should implement the IOscPacket interface.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._oscLink
member.summary: OSC Link in use with this Sender. Needs to be in targeted mode.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._packetHeapPriorityLayersTotal
member.summary: The total amount of priority levels in this Sender's packet heap.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._cycleLengthMs
member.summary: The length of the heap check cycle of this Sender - that is, the time between heap checks, in milliseconds. Shoudln't be less than 1.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._bundlePacketsBeforeSending
member.summary: Should this Sender bundle the packets before sending, or just send them as separate messages as they come.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._isActive
member.summary: Whether this Sender is currently active.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._packetHeap
member.summary: The packet heap, holding all the packets before they are processed and sent (or not). Implements several priority levels.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._packetHeapAccessMutex
member.summary: Used to facilitate orderly access to the packet heap.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._cycleBinaryDataHolder
member.summary: Holds the binary data pertaining to the current heap check cycle.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._packetMaxLength
member.summary: Maximum amount of data sent per packet, in bytes. As per UDP spec, sending more than 508 bytes per packet is not advisable.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._packetHeapTask
member.summary: The Task that performs the packet heap checks and manages it, sending the packets out when necessary.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._shouldSendPacket
member.summary: Checks whether the packet should be sent in the current cycle.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._shouldRemovePacket
member.summary: Checks whether the packet should be removed in the current cycle.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._timetagSource
member.summary: Provides timetags for the bundles this sender sends out.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.IsActive
member.summary: Whether this Sender is currently active.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.PacketHeapTaskStatus
member.summary: Shows the current status of the task processing the packet heap.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.BundlePacketsBeforeSending
member.summary: Should this Sender bundle the packets before sending, or just send them as separate messages as they come.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.CycleLengthMs
member.summary: The length of the heap check cycle of this Sender - that is, the time between heap checks, in milliseconds. Minimum 1 ms.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.PacketMaxLength
member.summary: Controls the maximum allowed length for outgoing OSC data packets. Minimum 128 bytes.

member.name: E:OscLib.OscSender`1.SendTaskExceptionRaised
member.summary: Invoked when an exception happens inside the send task, hopefully preventing it from stopping

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new OSC Sender.
member.param: Maximum amount of data sent per packet, in bytes. As per UDP spec, sending more than 508 bytes per packet is not advisable.
The length of the heap check cycle of this Sender - that is, the time between heap checks, in milliseconds. Shoudln't be less than 1.
The total amount of priority levels in this Sender's packet heap.
Should this Sender bundle the packets before sending, or just send them as separate messages as they come.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.Activate(OscLib.OscLink)
member.summary: Activates the Sender and connects it to an OSC Link.
member.param: The OSC Link this Sender will be sending packets through.
member.exception: Is thrown when the provided OSC Link is null.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.Deactivate
member.summary: Deactivates the sender, cancelling the heap processing task and detatching the sender from the OSC Link.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.SetMethodShouldSentPacket(OscLib.OscPacketHeapCheck{`0})
member.summary: Provides the method delegate for checking if a packet in the heap is eligible to be sent.
member.param: The method to be used for checking packets.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.SetMethodShouldRemovePacket(OscLib.OscPacketHeapCheck{`0})
member.summary: Provides the method delegate for checking if a packet needs to be removed from the heap.
member.param: The method to be used for removing packets.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.SendOscPacket(`0)
member.summary: Gets the binary data from the OSC packet and immediately sends it through the OSC Link as a message.
member.param: A reference to the OSC binary data packet to be sent.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to send data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.AddOscPacketToHeapHead(`0,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Inserts the packet to the beginning of the heap at the specified priority level, passing the packet directly.
Important to note: heap levels are processed tail-to-head, so the packet added by this method will be last in line.
Also, this method is slower than adding to heap tail.
member.param: The OSC binary data packet.
The priority level of the packet, with 0 being the highest priority.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to add data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the binary data packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.AddOscPacketToHeapTail(`0,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds the OSC packet to the end of the heap at the specified priority level, passing the packet directly.
Important to note: heap levels are processed tail-to-head, so the packet added by this method will be first in line.
This method is faster than adding to heap head.
member.param: The OSC binary data packet.
The priority level of the packet, with 0 being the highest priority.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to add data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the binary data packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.ProcessHeapLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Processes one level of data heap and sends either bundles or messages according to the setting.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.ToString
member.summary: Returns an overview of the packet heap, showing the number of packets per priority level.
